bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Paul H. Streit, January 16, 1953

div1.p: Hench is sending Streit a report on the Camp Lazear dedication, and would appreciate reimbursement for the flowers. He regrets that Streit was not able to attend.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Paul H. Streit, January 16, 1953
div1.opener:
January 16, 1953
Major General Paul H. Streit
Walter Reed Army Medical Center
Washington 12, D. C.
My dear General Streit:
div1.p:
I am sorry that I have not been able sooner to send you the enclosed
report on the dedication of Camp Lazear. Your presence was greatly
missed. Please see the enclosed copy of a letter I have just sent to
General Armstrong.

I ran out of newspaper clippings and since you were delegated to represent
General Armstrong and since your name is mentioned frequently in these
papers, I am sending you a more complete collection than that to General
Armstrong. If you think that he would care to see the ones which you only
are receiving, please let him see them or give them to him. The ones he
does have I have marked duplicate (“dup”) on your copy.

Thank you for your concern about the money. I would appreciate having
it whenever it is convenient and as per our later discussions two wreaths
were laid by substitutes for you in behalf of the Surgeon General (see my
letter to General Armstrong). The wreaths cost $15 each. They were really
very lovely so that if you can have approved for me a check for $30 I should
be glad to receive it at your convenience. The florist only gave me one bill
listing all the organizations presenting them. If you need a copy I can
have an ozalid copy made of mine. The company name of the florist was
“Milagros Flores”, Lucila Schumann, President.

It was indeed a shame that you were not there. You would have had a grand
time, would have met a great many very interesting and fine people and I
think you would have enjoyed the diplomatic and social functions that were
held in connection with the dedication.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH: alc
